metadata.synopsis: If Mol is dead or not present for other reasons, this solo dialogue for Raphael will take place instead.Rather than sitting at the lanceboard table, he is looming in the corner observing everyone else in Last Light.

20.speaker: Raphael
20.text: My, my, fancy meeting you here! Little late to be traipsing around Last Light, isn't it? You've lit the fire, you've freed the angel,  so shoo! Go after her!

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I wanted to ask you about the Infernal scars on my back. What do they mean?

25.speaker: Raphael
25.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I need a shot of liquid courage before I go. Perhaps you'll join me.

60.speaker: Raphael
60.text: Too parochial a setting for me, I'm afraid. I prefer my liquor served in a quivering belly button, distilled in fear and arousal.

37.speaker: Raphael
37.text: Anyway - don't linger here too long, will you? I've got front row tickets for your grand finale in Moonrise Towers, and I'm dying to see the show go on.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: A devil encouraging me to follow an angel. Aren't you full of surprises.

66.speaker: Raphael
66.text: Sometimes you've got to root for Team Celestial. Keeps you on your toes.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You really have a knack for showing up in all the wrong places.

69.speaker: Raphael
69.text: You've got a knack for giving me the dullest reply you could have possibly given.

55.speaker: Raphael
55.text: It's good to see you again. I'd ask if you've made any progress with your little problem, but the tell-tale twitching of your eye is answer enough.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael turns to the player and smiles.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: You again - I'm sure your arrival is simply a coincidence.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael leans in, pressing in on the player's personal space.

2.speaker: Raphael
2.text: My dear, nothing is coincidence. Mortals trifle themselves with free will, as if their betters have not moulded every potential path ahead.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael leans in, pressing in on the player's personal space.

62.speaker: Raphael
62.text: No offence meant, of course. I'm sure everyone in Last Light thinks they could have changed things.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael leans in, pressing in on the player's personal space.

27.text: They're not the only ones ripe for temptation, you know. My last contract here fed me for decades.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael leans in, pressing in on the player's personal space.

83.speaker: Raphael
83.text: They're not the only ones ripe for temptation, you know. My last contract here fed me for decades.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I wanted to ask you about the Infernal scars on my back. What do they mean?

58.speaker: Raphael
58.text: But of course, those curious little marks. Something important to your master, no doubt, but what?

43.speaker: Raphael
43.text: A love letter? A warning? A deed of ownership? I could give you all the gory details.

89.speaker: Raphael
89.text: But of course, you'll have to do something for me first. Let me think about it and get back to you.

23.speaker: Raphael
23.text: I do love the people I meet in these dark lands. Everyone's desperate for something.

75.speaker: Raphael
75.text: Family troubles. Not my family, of course.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: You're not responsible for the curse, are you?

64.speaker: Raphael
64.text: Please, I would never leave such a mess behind. Far too much attention for so little gain.

21.speaker: Raphael
21.text: At times I wonder if some other fiend swapped out your tongue with that of an ox.

8.speaker: Raphael
8.text: I never surrender knowledge for free, but one good turn deserves another, does it not? To repay you for the souls sent my way, I offer a taste of the truth.

17.speaker: Raphael
17.text: Ketheric Thorm - proud father, man of faith, utter fool. On the night the Harpers sealed him away, someone murdered his entire army in cold blood.

4.speaker: Raphael
4.text: Now who would possibly benefit from such a massacre?

44.speaker: Raphael
44.text: If you want to know more, I could work the exchange of such precious knowledge into the terms of your future deal.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

82.speaker: Raphael
82.text: But the time for quibbling over clauses and contracts hasn't quite arrived. You'll be limping back to me soon enough.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Not with you, at least. Although I sense there's something your friend wants to ask me.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

46.speaker: Raphael
46.text: Not with you, at least. Although I sense there's something your friend wants to ask me.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: I do. I have a proposal for you.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

42.speaker: Raphael
42.text: A proposal? If you're hoping to taste my blood, little vampling, think again. It burns hotter than Wyvern Whiskey.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

0.speaker: Astarion
0.text: My old - well, a long time ago someone carved infernal runes into my back. They are a fragment of a contract. I'd like to know what the full contract says.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

53.speaker: Raphael
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: What are you talking about, Astarion? What scars?
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

19.speaker: Raphael
19.text: You haven't told them? And you've kept your clothes on this whole time? How unlike you.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

54.speaker: Raphael
54.text: Why not let them see? Don't be shy.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael waves his hand and Astarion's shirt magically disappears.

70.context: NodeContext: Fed up with this shit (a devil just magicked away your shirt.)

56.speaker: Astarion
56.context: NodeContext: Fed up with this shit (a devil just magicked away your shirt.)

61.speaker: Raphael
61.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

52.speaker: Raphael
52.text: Why didn't you tell me earlier? I could have helped.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Why didn't you tell me earlier? I could have helped.

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: I - perhaps I should have. I'm not exactly used to asking for help and being met with, well... help.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: But what's done is done, so how about we stop talking about it and just get on with things?

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: Although I should probably get dressed first...

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Gods... the carving must have been excruciating.

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: Cazador worked on it from dusk until dawn, all with an ancient blade he called his 'needle'. Cutting and tearing, starting over if I screamed or winced too much.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: All I know is you have us doing odd jobs for a devil.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: It could be infinitely worse. We seem to be rather good at killing things.

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: Let's just go. Standing here chatting gets us nowhere.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Don't play games Raphael. Help him out.

91.speaker: Raphael
91.text: It's something very important to your master. But is it a love letter, a warning, or a deed of ownership? I could give you all the gory details.

11.speaker: Raphael
11.text: But of course, you'll have to do something for me first. Let me think about it and get back to you.

39.speaker: Astarion
39.text: You'll 'get back' to me? This is important, devil. When?

34.speaker: Raphael
34.text: Don't worry - I'm motivated to help you. Scars often tell such wonderful stories - I think yours might be truly exquisite. I'll see you soon.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: This is a bad idea Astarion. We should find another way.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: My old - well, a long time ago someone carved some runes into my back. I'd rather like to know what they say.
18.context: NodeContext: Starts saying 'my old master...' but stops himself

49.speaker: Raphael
49.text: With your tail between your legs.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael disappears from the room, leaving behind nothing but a bare wall.

5.speaker: Raphael
5.text: For now, I'm afraid you've already made me late for a meeting with another client. I'll see you soon.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael disappears from the room, leaving behind nothing but a bare wall.

67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael disappears from the room, leaving behind nothing but a bare wall.

29.speaker: Raphael
29.text: You flatter yourself - you're not the only soul of interest in this ruin. This is Last Light, where hope hangs on by a single withered thread.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I'm fine - the last thing I need is your meddling.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Wipe that smugness from your face or I'll smite it off.

72.speaker: Raphael
72.text: You're the best thing for business since the Second Sundering. Countless sorry souls came running to my door after your work in the grove.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael turns to the player and smiles.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I'd have sent more souls your way, but I ran out of tieflings to kill.

15.speaker: Raphael
15.text: Such a shame to end a spree before you've tired of the slaughter. But don't be disheartened.

77.speaker: Raphael
77.text: After all - here you are again, in a refuge for the haggard and weary. Plenty of clients - or victims - for both of us.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Enjoy them while you can - I'll smite you down soon enough.

10.speaker: Raphael
10.text: You wound me. I've only tried to be a friend to you - just as to the poor souls here, where hope hangs by a single thread.

73.speaker: Raphael
73.text: I can mend it or cut it, depending on what they ask for.
